title: Paul’s Farewell to Ephesus
shortSummary: Acts 20 recounts Paul's journey through Macedonia and Greece, his extended stay in Troas where a young man is miraculously revived, and his heartfelt farewell to the Ephesian elders. This chapter highlights Paul’s dedication to ministry, his warnings against false teachers, and his encouragement to remain faithful in shepherding the church.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul's Third Missionary Journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and primary figure in this chapter, Paul travels through Macedonia and Greece, preaches, and delivers a moving farewell address to the Ephesian elders.

keyCharacters.name: Eutychus
keyCharacters.description: A young man who falls asleep during Paul’s long sermon in Troas, falls from a third-story window, and is miraculously brought back to life by Paul.

keyCharacters.name: Elders of Ephesus
keyCharacters.description: The leaders of the Ephesian church whom Paul summons to give final instructions and warnings about future dangers to the flock.

keyCharacters.name: Timotheus (Timothy)
keyCharacters.description: A trusted companion of Paul who accompanies him on his journey and ministry.

definitions.definition: Followers of Jesus Christ who learn from His teachings and live according to His example.
A term referring to the Christian practice of communion or the Lord’s Supper, symbolizing fellowship and remembrance of Christ’s sacrifice.
Church leaders or elders appointed to shepherd and care for the spiritual well-being of the congregation.
Metaphorical expression for false teachers or harmful influences that seek to destroy the church from within.

outline.heading: Paul’s Journey and Ministry in Macedonia and Greece
outline.description: Paul travels through Macedonia and Greece, encouraging disciples and avoiding a Jewish plot, while companions wait for him in Troas where they stay for seven days.

outline.heading: The Gathering at Troas and the Miracle of Eutychus
outline.description: On the first day of the week, believers gather to break bread and hear Paul preach late into the night; a young man named Eutychus falls asleep, falls from a window, and is restored to life by Paul, demonstrating God’s power and care.

outline.heading: Paul’s Travel to Miletus and His Farewell to Ephesian Elders
outline.description: Paul travels to Miletus and summons the Ephesian elders, delivering a heartfelt farewell speech emphasizing his faithful ministry, warnings against false teachers, encouragement to shepherd the church, and his readiness to face suffering for the gospel.

application: Commit to faithful ministry and service with humility and perseverance, even in the face of opposition and hardship.
Be vigilant against false teachings and protect the church by adhering closely to God’s Word and sound doctrine.
Support and care for fellow believers, especially the weak, reflecting Christ’s love through generosity and service.
Value Christian fellowship and the regular gathering of believers to encourage one another and partake in the Lord’s Supper.

keyVerses.text: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry, which I have received of the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals Paul’s unwavering commitment to his calling despite trials, encouraging believers to persevere joyfully in their God-given mission.

keyVerses.text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God, which he hath purchased with his own blood.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn charge to church leaders to diligently care for the congregation, recognizing the precious cost of Christ’s sacrifice.

keyVerses.text: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
keyVerses.significance: Paul models and teaches generosity and care for the vulnerable, highlighting the blessing found in giving.

keyVerses.text: Therefore watch, and remember, that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears.
keyVerses.significance: Paul’s persistent and heartfelt warning underscores the seriousness of guarding the church against spiritual dangers.
